description.narrative: The Regional Assistance Mission to Solomon Islands (RAMSI) Development Implementation Facilities initiative assists the implementation of its civilian development programs, ranging from planning and design, engagement of technical advisers, logistics support and deliver of outcomes, to support the implementation of the RAMSI Partnership Framework. The initiative offers economies of scale, efficiency savings and value for money. The program redesign in 2010 enhanced the shared learning opportunities across the three development pillars (Law and Justice, Machinery of Government, Economic Governance) with a greater emphasis on alternative modalities to technical assistance and a more sophisticated and evidence based approach to capacity development within the Solomon Islands Government. The total value of this initiative is $27.1 million over 3 years, starting 2010-11.
